en.hi.dtsapp.controller

Class TourCatalog

  • java.lang.Object
    • en.hi.dtsapp.controller.TourCatalog

  • public class TourCatalog
extends java.lang.Object
    Class objective: Accepts input, optionally validates it, and converts it to commands for the model or view. Here's what you need to know to use it: public TourCatalog() constructor. Builds two private variables: TOUR_LIST contains every single Tour from the Tour database DISTINCT_NAME_TOUR_LIST contains only one of each (by name, i.e. no repetitions of the same tour on other dates) public ObservableList getFullTourList() returns an ObserveableList copy of TOUR_LIST which contains every single tour from the database public ObservableList getDistinctNameTourList() returns an ObserveableList copy of DISTINCT_NAME_TOUR_LIST (for easy browsing) There are two methods you will be using: getToursBySearchParameters(..) bookTour(..) see detailed documentation right below.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean bookTour(Tour tour, int passengers)
      Primary method for booking a tour If successful in action, this class should: Increase the number of bookings of the specified tour by amount passengers, Register a booking for that exact tour in the Booking Table, If it returns a value, it has either done both of those things or neither.

      • getToursBySearchParameters

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Tour> getToursBySearchParameters(java.lang.String keyword,
                                                                          java.time.LocalDate dateFrom,
                                                                          java.time.LocalDate dateTo,
                                                                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> keywordExceptions)
        Primary method for receiving an observable list filtered by some (User) Input See overloaded method without List input parameter to ignore exceptions.
        Parameters:
        keyword - String
        dateFrom - LocalDate
        dateTo - LocalDate
        keywordExceptions - List of Strings that will be excluded from the search
        Returns:
        ObservableList with all the tours in TOUR_LIST that are within the specified dates [dateFrom, dateTo], both included, and have anything to do with any of the words in the String keyword, e.g. it's part of TourName, TourOperator, TourLocation, TourInfo or TourKeywords. If the String keyword is in keywordExceptions, the method will not filter the list (e.g. put UI SearchField promptText into this List) Returns an empty list if DateTo is before DateFrom, Returns an empty list if keyword is just some nonsense

      • getToursBySearchParameters

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Tour> getToursBySearchParameters(java.lang.String keyword,
                                                                          java.time.LocalDate dateFrom,
                                                                          java.time.LocalDate dateTo)
        Primary method for receiving an observable list filtered by some (User) Input See overloaded method with additional List input parameter for exceptions.
        Parameters:
        keyword - String
        dateFrom - LocalDate
        dateTo - LocalDate
        Returns:
        ObservableList with all the tours in TOUR_LIST that are within the specified dates [dateFrom, dateTo], both included, and have anything to do with any of the words in the String keyword, e.g. it's part of TourName, TourOperator, TourLocation, TourInfo or TourKeywords. Returns an empty list if DateTo is before DateFrom, Returns an empty list if keyword is just some nonsense

      • bookTour

        public boolean bookTour(Tour tour,
                        int passengers)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.sql.SQLException,
                        java.lang.NullPointerException
        Primary method for booking a tour If successful in action, this class should: Increase the number of bookings of the specified tour by amount passengers, Register a booking for that exact tour in the Booking Table, If it returns a value, it has either done both of those things or neither.
        Parameters:
        tour - tour that the CustomerPerson wants to book.
        passengers - number of passengers/travelers included in booking.
        Returns:
        true if the tour was inserted into the database, false if tour was already in the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if customer person has not been initialized.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if some input is in the wrong format. or email is already in use. Catch it and print the error message.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - JDBC Driver class not found.
        java.sql.SQLException - Failed to get connection to database, or unexplained error from ResultSet.
